New Records: Rachin Ravindra became the youngest player to score a century in an ODI World Cup
Devon Conway scored the fastest century (82 balls) in the tournament so far
Mitchell Santner bowled a 10-over spell without conceding a boundary
Key Match Events: New Zealand won by 9 wickets with 82 balls remaining
Matt Henry dismissed Jos Buttler with a crucial wicket
England scored 282 for 9 in their innings
Pre-Game Insights: England had several key players missing due to injuries
Tom Latham, the New Zealand captain, decided to bowl early and take wickets in crucial moments
Post-Match Reflections: Devon Conway and Rachin Ravindra were praised for their performances
England's batting, especially Joe Root's control and Jos Buttler's ability, was highlighted
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Narendra Modi Stadium was half-empty
New Zealand performed well despite missing key players
The match was significant for New Zealand's young players
Others: The article provided detailed statistics and insights into the game
New Zealand's spinners and fast bowlers performed well
England struggled against New Zealand's spinners
